name: Won Tons
author: Danielle Tarango
summary: These won tons are easy and amazingly good. Trick all of your friends into thinking you are a gourmet in just 20 minutes! Please note! Won tons are best when they are eaten directly after cooking. This recipe can be made in advance, however wait to fry them until just before serving. Wasabi can be found in many common grocery stores and Asian grocery stores.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package small won ton wrappers
directions: In a small mixing bowl, combine mustard, soy sauce and wasabi until the wasabi has dissolved
Place cream cheese in a large bowl (preferably chilled metal)
Mix in crab meat, onion, water chestnuts and parsley
Place one spoonful of the mixture in the center of each won ton wrapper
Bring points of the wrapper together (in a triangular shape) and pinch the edges closed
If the edges do not stick together, wet your fingertips lightly with water and pinch the ends together again (this will help to hold the won ton together)
Heat oil in a large skillet
When oil is hot, place won tons (approximately 6 at a time) into hot oil
Remove the won tons when they are golden brown
Drain them on a paper towel lined tray
Repeat this process until all won tons are fried
